body_html:
As @wchargin points out, it's due to loading of tf.contrib. Here's a self-contained benchmark which doesn't show the difference

import time
import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np

a = [1]*10000
tf.contrib.util.make_ndarray
for i in range(5):
  from tensorflow.python.framework import tensor_util
  tensor_proto = tensor_util.make_tensor_proto(a)
  a = time.time()
  array = tf.contrib.util.make_ndarray(tensor_proto)
  b = time.time()
  print('b-a', b-a)

body:
As @wchargin points out, it's due to loading of tf.contrib. Here's a self-contained benchmark which doesn't show the difference


```
import time
import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np

a = [1]*10000
tf.contrib.util.make_ndarray
for i in range(5):
  from tensorflow.python.framework import tensor_util
  tensor_proto = tensor_util.make_tensor_proto(a)
  a = time.time()
  array = tf.contrib.util.make_ndarray(tensor_proto)
  b = time.time()
  print('b-a', b-a)
```
